Cloudinary is a cloud-based image and vi: Cloudinary is a cloud-based image and video management platform that allows you to upload, store, manage, and deliver your media assets. It provides a range of features for image and video optimization, transformation, and delivery.
Your Cloudinary API Key. Found in Consol: Your Cloudinary API Key. Found in Console Settings → API Keys page.
Your Cloudinary API Secret. Found in Con: Your Cloudinary API Secret. Found in Console Settings → API Keys page. Keep this secure and never share publicly.
Your Cloudinary Cloud Name. Found in Con: Your Cloudinary Cloud Name. Found in Console Settings → API Keys page or in your dashboard URL (e.g., "demo" from console.cloudinary.com/console/demo).
Enter your Cloudinary account credential: Enter your Cloudinary account credentials. Find these in your Cloudinary Console settings under the API keys page.
Upload a new image, video, or file to Cl: Upload a new image, video, or file to Cloudinary.
Permanently delete images, videos, or fi: Permanently delete images, videos, or files from Cloudinary.
Generate a comprehensive report of accou: Generate a comprehensive report of account usage and quotas including storage, bandwidth, transformations, requests, and add-on usage.
Retrieve details of an asset using its u: Retrieve details of an asset using its unique public ID.
Apply transformations (resize, crop, wat: Apply transformations (resize, crop, watermark, etc.) to an asset and generate a new URL.
The file to upload to Cloudinary.
The public ID for the uploaded resource. If not specified, a random ID will be generated.
Select an existing folder or type a new: Select an existing folder or type a new folder path (e.g., "samples/animals")
Select existing tags or type new ones: Select existing tags or type new ones
Whether to overwrite existing assets wit: Whether to overwrite existing assets with the same public ID.
Whether to use the original file name as: Whether to use the original file name as the public ID.
Choose how to specify assets for deletio: Choose how to specify assets for deletion
Select the type of resource to upload to: Select the type of resource to upload to Cloudinary.
Select assets to delete by their public: Select assets to delete by their public IDs
Or type comma-separated public IDs manua: Or type comma-separated public IDs manually (up to 100). Example: image1,image2,folder/image3
Select existing tags or type new ones (c: Select existing tags or type new ones (comma-separated)
Or type tag name manually to delete all: Or type tag name manually to delete all assets with this tag (up to 1000 assets)
Delete all assets whose public ID starts: Delete all assets whose public ID starts with this prefix (up to 1000 assets)
The delivery type of assets to delete: The delivery type of assets to delete
Delete only derived assets, keep the ori: Delete only derived assets, keep the original
Whether to invalidate CDN cached copies. Takes a few minutes to propagate.
Date for the usage report. Must be withi: Date for the usage report. Must be within the last 3 months. Leave empty for current date.
Whether to include detailed breakdown of: Whether to include detailed breakdown of transformation types and add-on usage in the response.
Select an asset to find by its public ID: Select an asset to find by its public ID
Or enter the public ID manually if not f: Or enter the public ID manually if not found in dropdown (e.g., "sample", "folder/image-name")
The delivery type of the asset: The delivery type of the asset
Or enter public ID manually if not in dr: Or enter public ID manually if not in dropdown
How to handle resizing when aspect ratio: How to handle resizing when aspect ratios differ
Which part to focus on when cropping: Which part to focus on when cropping
Advanced: Raw transformation string (e.g: Advanced: Raw transformation string (e.g., "c_fill,w_300,h_200/e_sepia/r_20"). This will be applied after the above basic transformations.
If true, only return the transformation: If true, only return the transformation URL. If false, also make a request to generate the transformed asset.
Triggers when a new image, video, or fil: Triggers when a new image, video, or file is uploaded to a specific folder or account in Cloudinary.
Triggers when a tag is added to an asset: Triggers when a tag is added to an asset in Cloudinary.
The Cloudinary folder to watch for new r: The Cloudinary folder to watch for new resources. Leave empty to watch the entire account.
The type of resources to monitor for tag: The type of resources to monitor for tag changes
Optional: Watch only assets in this spec: Optional: Watch only assets in this specific folder. Leave empty to watch all assets.
